intro: Boscia variabilis, commonly known as the variable bosco, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds. Boscia variabilis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
